department.dept_long_name: Committee on Higher Degrees in Biostatistics

course.title: Probability Theory and Applications II
course.meeting_text: M., W., 1:30–3:20, and a weekly 90-minute lab.
course.description: A foundational course in measure theoretic probability. Topics include measure theory, Lebesgue integration, product measure and Fubini's Theorem, Radon-Nikodym derivatives, conditional probability, conditional expectation, limit theorems on sequences of random variables, stochastic processes, and weak convergence.
course.prerequisites: Biostatistics 231, or permission of instructor required.
course.notes: Offered jointly with the School of Public Health as BIO250.
